entry.title: Latex Formulas
entry.content:
Matrix

Different kinds of Matrices

array[2−1351381−4−45−34100315−5](1)array \hspace{1em}\left[\begin{array}{ccc}2 & -1 & 3 & 5 & 1\\3 & 8 & 1 & -4 & -4\\5 & -3 & 4 & 1 & 0\\0 & 3 & 1 & 5 & -5\end{array}\right]\tag{1}array⎣⎢⎢⎡​2350​−18−33​3141​5−415​1−40−5​⎦⎥⎥⎤​(1)


bmatrix[ABCDEFGHI](2)bmatrix \hspace{1em}\begin{bmatrix}A & B & C\\D & E & F\\G & H & I\\\end{bmatrix}\tag{2}bmatrix⎣⎡​ADG​BEH​CFI​⎦⎤​(2)


pmatrix(2−1351381−4−45−34100315−5)(3)pmatrix \hspace{1em}\begin{pmatrix}2 & -1 & 3 & 5 & 1\\3 & 8 & 1 & -4 & -4\\5 & -3 & 4 & 1 & 0\\0 & 3 & 1 & 5 & -5\end{pmatrix} \tag{3}pmatrix⎝⎜⎜⎛​2350​−18−33​3141​5−415​1−40−5​⎠⎟⎟⎞​(3)


vmatrix∣a1112a12a21a22∣(4)vmatrix \hspace{1em}\begin{vmatrix}a_{11} & _{1^2}a_{12} \\a_{21} & a_{22}\end{vmatrix}\tag{4}vmatrix∣∣∣∣​a11​a21​​12​a12​a22​​∣∣∣∣​(4)


Vmatrix∥A11A22⋱⋱⋱Ann∥(5)Vmatrix \hspace{1em}\begin{Vmatrix}A_{11} & & & & & \\& A_{22} & & & & \\& & \ddots & & & \\& & & \ddots & & \\& & & & \ddots & \\& & & & & A_{nn}\end{Vmatrix}\tag{5}Vmatrix∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥​A11​​A22​​⋱​⋱​⋱​Ann​​∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥∥​(5)

Some Trouble

The Latex code is presented in Fig.1.1. In normal latex codes, double backslashes ( \\ ) is used to start a new line.However, due to the conflicts between the markdown renderer engine (marked.js) syntax and the latex syntax, it willnot be rendered properly. "\\" will first be recognized as an escape character "\" by marked.js.

So, if you want to change line in a latex block, you need to type four backslashes (Fig.1.1). Some other syntax alsoshare the same problems. Take 'Underscore' (_) as an example, in markdown, if a string was surrounded by two '_', thestring will be in italics, while _ means subscript in Latex.

Trouble has been solved!

I changed the markdown rendering engine of my blog on Jun. 14, replaced the old one, marked.js, withmarkdown-it-plus. Now I don't need to type fourbackslashes in formulas anymore (see Fig.1.2), the "underscore problem" has also been solved. More importantly, theportability of the latex codes in my blogs is much better now 😄.

System of Equations


{x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2(6)\begin{cases}x + y + z=0 \\x + 2y + 3z=1 \\x - 4y + 5z=2\end{cases}\tag{6}⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2​(6)


{K1=zk,L1=f(xk,yk,zk),K2=zk+h2Γ1,L2=f(xk+h2,yk+h2K1,zk+h2L1),K3=zk+h2Γ2,L3=f(xk+h2,yk+h2K2,zk+h2L2),K4=zk+hΓ3,L4=f(xk+h,yk+hK3,zk+hL3).(7)\left\{\begin{array}{ll}K_{1}=z_{k},&L_{1}=f\left(x_{k},y_{k},z_{k}\right),\\[1ex]K_{2}=z_{k}+\frac{h}{2}\varGamma_{1},&L_{2}=f\left(x_{k}+\frac{h}{2},y_{k}+\frac{h}{2}K_{1},z_{k}+\frac{h}{2}L_{1}\right),\\[1ex]K_{3}=z_{k}+\frac{h}{2}\varGamma_{2},&L_{3}=f\left(x_{k}+\frac{h}{2},y_{k}+\frac{h}{2}K_{2},z_{k}+\frac{h}{2}L_{2}\right),\\[1ex]K_{4}=z_{k}+h\varGamma_{3},&L_{4}=f\left(x_{k}+h,y_{k}+hK_{3},z_{k}+hL_{3}\right).\\\end{array}\right.\tag{7}⎩⎪⎪⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎪⎪⎧​K1​=zk​,K2​=zk​+2h​Γ1​,K3​=zk​+2h​Γ2​,K4​=zk​+hΓ3​,​L1​=f(xk​,yk​,zk​),L2​=f(xk​+2h​,yk​+2h​K1​,zk​+2h​L1​),L3​=f(xk​+2h​,yk​+2h​K2​,zk​+2h​L2​),L4​=f(xk​+h,yk​+hK3​,zk​+hL3​).​(7)


{∫0xs(t) dt=∫0x[∑n=0∞antn]dt=∑n=0∞∫0xantndt=∑n=0∞ann+1xn+1(x∈I),xdy−(y+x2+y2)dx=0(x>0),F(b)−F(a)G(b)−G(a)=F′(ξ)G′(ξ)(ξ∈(a,b)).(8)\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\displaystyle\int_{0}^{x} s(t)\, dt = \int_{0}^{x}\left[ \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a_nt^n \right] dt = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \int_{0}^{x} a_nt^n dt= \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{a_n}{n+1}x^{n+1}\hspace{1em} ( x\in \mathbf{I} ), \\[5ex]\displaystyle x dy - (y + \sqrt{x^2 + y^2}) dx = 0\hspace{1em}(x > 0), \\[5ex]\displaystyle\frac{F(b) - F(a)}{G(b) - G(a)} = \frac{F^\prime(\xi)}{G^\prime({\xi})} \hspace{1em}( \xi \in (a,b)).\\\end{array}\right.\tag{8}⎩⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎧​∫0x​s(t)dt=∫0x​[n=0∑∞​an​tn]dt=n=0∑∞​∫0x​an​tndt=n=0∑∞​n+1an​​xn+1(x∈I),xdy−(y+x2+y2​)dx=0(x>0),G(b)−G(a)F(b)−F(a)​=G′(ξ)F′(ξ)​(ξ∈(a,b)).​(8)

Other formulas


AB→⋅CD→(8)\overrightarrow{AB} \cdot \overrightarrow{CD}\tag{8}AB⋅CD(8)

LSTM Formulas

{a(t)=b+Wh(t+1)+Ux(t),h(t)=tanh(a(t)),o(t)=c+Vh(t),y(t)=softmax(o(t)).(9)\left\{\begin{array}{ll}a^{(t)} = b + W h^{(t+1)} + U x^{(t)}, \\[2mm]h^{(t)} = tanh(a^{(t)}), \\[2mm]o^{(t)} = c + Vh^{(t)}, \\[2mm]y^{(t)} = softmax(o^{(t)}).\\\end{array}\right.\tag{9}⎩⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎧​a(t)=b+Wh(t+1)+Ux(t),h(t)=tanh(a(t)),o(t)=c+Vh(t),y(t)=softmax(o(t)).​(9)

\left\{\begin{array}{ll}a^{(t)} = b + W h^{(t+1)} + U x^{(t)}, \\[2mm]h^{(t)} = tanh(a^{(t)}), \\[2mm]o^{(t)} = c + Vh^{(t)}, \\[2mm]y^{(t)} = softmax(o^{(t)}).\\\end{array}\right.\tag{9}

if __name__ == '__main__':    if len(sys.argv) == 1:        watermark()    elif (len(sys.argv) == 2) and (sys.argv[1] == 'clean'):        before = u'./before/*'        for item in glob.glob(before):            os.remove(item)    else:        err_msg = u'[Input error]:\n' \                  u'  Available modes:\n' \                  u'  [no arg] - proceed program\n' \                  u'  [clean]  - clean pictures in before/'        print(err_msg)
<a href="https://github.com/XZhou-AMsZaure/xzhou-amszaure.github.io" class="github-corner tooltipped hide-on-med-and-down" target="_blank"   data-tooltip="Fork Me" data-position="left" data-delay="50">    <svg viewBox="0 0 250 250" aria-hidden="true">        <path d="M0,0 L115,115 L130,115 L142,142 L250,250 L250,0 Z"></path>        <path d="M128.3,109.0 C113.8,99.7 119.0,89.6 119.0,89.6 C122.0,82.7 120.5,78.6 120.5,78.6 C119.2,72.0 123.4,76.3 123.4,76.3 C127.3,80.9 125.5,87.3 125.5,87.3 C122.9,97.6 130.6,101.9 134.4,103.2"              fill="currentColor" style="transform-origin: 130px 106px;" class="octo-arm"></path>        <path d="M115.0,115.0 C114.9,115.1 118.7,116.5 119.8,115.4 L133.7,101.6 C136.9,99.2 139.9,98.4 142.2,98.6 C133.8,88.0 127.5,74.4 143.8,58.0 C148.5,53.4 154.0,51.2 159.7,51.0 C160.3,49.4 163.2,43.6 171.4,40.1 C171.4,40.1 176.1,42.5 178.8,56.2 C183.1,58.6 187.2,61.8 190.9,65.4 C194.5,69.0 197.7,73.2 200.1,77.6 C213.8,80.2 216.3,84.9 216.3,84.9 C212.7,93.1 206.9,96.0 205.4,96.6 C205.1,102.4 203.0,107.8 198.3,112.5 C181.9,128.9 168.3,122.5 157.7,114.1 C157.9,116.9 156.7,120.9 152.7,124.9 L141.0,136.5 C139.8,137.7 141.6,141.9 141.8,141.8 Z"              fill="currentColor" class="octo-body"></path>    </svg></a>

This is an inline formula: aaa

entry.title: Different Views of a Linear System of Equations
entry.content:
Row Picture

Take the linear system of equations (1.1) as an example. Each equation can be seen as a plane in 3D space, so, thissystem of equations represents three different planes, and the solution of the set will be the intersection point ofthese three planes. Here, the solution is x=−12,y=0,z=12x = - \frac{1}{2}, y = 0, z=\frac{1}{2}x=−21​,y=0,z=21​. I used Mathematica to visualizethat (see Fig.1.1 and 1.2)

{x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2(1.1)\begin{cases}x + y + z=0 \\x + 2y + 3z=1 \\x - 4y + 5z=2\end{cases}\tag{1.1}⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2​(1.1)

In this simple case, we can easily find the solution with computer or even by drawing on the paper [1]. However, if thenumber of equations [2] and variables increase [2:1], the visualization will [3] be hard or impossible for now. In 1.2, there areeight variables in eight equations. Each equation represents a 7D space 😕, which cannot be visualized.

{2x1+3x2+2x3−3x4−2x5+12x6+5x7−x8=−1−1x1−4x2+34x3+8x4−27x5+3x6+2x7+3x8=5−4x1+7x2+3x4−7x5+12x6+5x7+4x8=103x1+12x2+x3−14x4−5x5−3x6+8x7−11x8=−47x1−8x2+16x3+9x4−x5+9x6−5x7+6x8=−169x1+3x2−5x3+5x4+12x5+20x7+7x8=8−x1+6x2−3x3+21x4+2x5−3x6+13x7−x8=6174x1+78x2+4x3+3x4−3x5+7x6+5x7+3x8=−9(1.2)\begin{cases}2x_1 + 3x_2 + 2x_3 - 3x_4 - 2x_5 + \frac{1}{2}x_6 + 5x_7 - x_8 = -1 \\[1ex]-1x_1 - 4x_2 + \frac{3}{4}x_3 + 8x_4 -\frac{2}{7}x_5 + 3x_6 + 2x_7 + 3x_8 = 5\\[1ex]-4x_1 + 7x_2 + 3x_4 - 7x_5 + \frac{1}{2}x_6 + 5x_7 + 4x_8 = 10\\[1ex]3x_1 + 12x_2 + x_3 - 14x_4 - 5x_5 - 3x_6 + 8x_7 - 11x_8 = -4\\[1ex]7x_1 - 8x_2 + 16x_3 + 9x_4 - x_5 + 9x_6 - 5x_7 + 6x_8 = -16\\[1ex]9x_1 + 3x_2 - 5x_3 + 5x_4 + 12x_5 + 20x_7 + 7x_8 = 8\\[1ex]-x_1 + 6x_2 - 3x_3 + 21x_4 + 2x_5 - 3x_6 + 13x_7 - x_8 = \frac{6}{17}\\[1ex]4x_1 + \frac{7}{8}x_2 + 4x_3 + 3x_4 - 3x_5 + 7x_6 + 5x_7 + 3x_8 = -9\end{cases}\tag{1.2}⎩⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎧​2x1​+3x2​+2x3​−3x4​−2x5​+21​x6​+5x7​−x8​=−1−1x1​−4x2​+43​x3​+8x4​−72​x5​+3x6​+2x7​+3x8​=5−4x1​+7x2​+3x4​−7x5​+21​x6​+5x7​+4x8​=103x1​+12x2​+x3​−14x4​−5x5​−3x6​+8x7​−11x8​=−47x1​−8x2​+16x3​+9x4​−x5​+9x6​−5x7​+6x8​=−169x1​+3x2​−5x3​+5x4​+12x5​+20x7​+7x8​=8−x1​+6x2​−3x3​+21x4​+2x5​−3x6​+13x7​−x8​=176​4x1​+87​x2​+4x3​+3x4​−3x5​+7x6​+5x7​+3x8​=−9​(1.2)

Column Picture

Again, let's consider the system of equations (1.1). This time, each column of these equations are viewed as acolumn vector. That system of equations can be seen as a combination of column vectors.

{x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2⟶x[111]+y[12−4]+z[135]=[012]\begin{cases}x + \hspace{0.5em}y + \hspace{0.5em}z=0 \\x + 2y + 3z=1 \\x - 4y + 5z=2\end{cases}\hspace{1em}\longrightarrow\hspace{1em}x \begin{bmatrix}1\\1\\1 \end{bmatrix}+y \begin{bmatrix}1\\2\\-4 \end{bmatrix}+z \begin{bmatrix}1\\3\\5\end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}0\\1\\2\end{bmatrix}⎩⎪⎨⎪⎧​x+y+z=0x+2y+3z=1x−4y+5z=2​⟶x⎣⎡​111​⎦⎤​+y⎣⎡​12−4​⎦⎤​+z⎣⎡​135​⎦⎤​=⎣⎡​012​⎦⎤​

The equations are transferred to linear combinations of vectors. Thus, solving the system of equations is to findsuitable xxx, yyy and zzz so that the combination of the vectors on the left hand of equation equals to the vector onthe right hand.

Compared with the row picture, it's easier to be understood in high dimension cases. For the system of equations(1.2), it can be viewed as a combination of eight 8D vectors, creating another vector in 8D space. No matter how highthe dimension is, a vector can always be represented by an arrow. You don't need to imagine a 7D space.

  1. This is a footnote ↩︎

  2. This is footnote no.2 ↩︎ ↩︎

  3. Google ↩︎

entry.title: Second Post for Testing
entry.content:
Some Thoughts

  • The best way to learn something is to get familiar with its backbone as quick as you can.
    you don't necessarily need to know all the concepts, or to understand all the equations.
    DO NOT be distracted by those fancy equations!!

entry.title: About This Blog
entry.content:
When？

2022年6月

Why？

一个原因是想做学习笔记，每天都写点，算是种监督自己学习;

What？

Who？

Where？

How？

How much？
